metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7212 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: The _encode_invalid_chars function in util/url.py in the urllib3 library1.25.2 through 1.25.7 for Python allows a denial of service (CPUconsumption) because of an inefficient algorithm. The percent_encodingsarray contains all matches of percent encodings. It is not deduplicated.For a URL of length N, the size of percent_encodings may be up to O(N). Thenext step (normalize existing percent-encoded bytes) also takes up to O(N)for each step, so the total time is O(N^2). If percent_encodings werededuplicated, the time to compute _encode_invalid_chars would be O(kN),where k is at most 484 ((10+6*2)^2).

criterions.comment: python-urllib3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
